flawed_nl_solution:
At a 10 percent discount, Jordyn will pay 10/100%*$5=$0.5 less for a bag of cherries.
To buy one of the cherries at a 10% discount Jordyn will pay $5-$0.5=<<5-0.5=4.5>>4.5
The cost of buying 50 bags of cherries at the 10% discount is 50*4.5=<<50*4.5=225>>225
Also, at a 10% discount, Jordyn will pay 10/100*$7=<<10/100*7=0.7>>0.7 less for a bag of olives.
The price of a bag of olives at a 10% discount is $7-$0.7=<<7-0.7=6.3>>6.3
To buy 50 bags of olives Jordyn will pay $6.3*50=<<6.3*50=135>>135
The total cost of buying 50 bags of each fruit at a 10% discount is $135+$225=$360
#### 360

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 315, not 135. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
